results.title: Visit to an airport
results.creator_credit: Yvonne MacKay, Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Two children visit an airport and learn about various aspects of its operation; luggage checks, plane checks, take-off procedures, control tower operations, food preparation and movement of food into the planes.

results.title: The Age of change
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Looks at the impact of technological change on the Melbourne newspaper ‘The Age’ and considers this change in terms of its effect on the people involved. Highlights the increasing competition at the desk of reporters and editors from electronic information systems, and the impact of technology on the once labour-intensive area of printing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Born in fire
results.creator_credit: Guy Baskin, Shepherd Baker Studios and Woodside Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description: Depicts the final stages of construction, as well as the tow, launch and placement of the substructure for the first offshore production platform for the North West Shelf Project. The aim of the project is to develop a natural gas field to supply power for domestic and industrial use in Perth and southwest Western Australia. Narrated by John Waters. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Milk at its best
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson and Michael Robertson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how advances in technology have brought about a major change in the production and marketing of milk in the past few years. Notes the use of fully automated systems in dairies which ensure maximum efficiency and cleanliness, and how further tests are carried out in laboratories before packaging or bottling. All aspects of milk production are supervised by the Dairy Industry Marketing Authority which exercises strict control over hygiene. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Health connection
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, Ferryman Productions and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Looks at the operation of the NSW sewage system, in particular around the Sydney area. Shows the maintenance of the existing operation as well as the planning and construction of additional services to meet the increasing demands newly-settled areas. Stresses the quality control that is implemented to ensure that pollution levels remain below those that could endanger the health of the community.

results.title: A Voice for the wilderness
results.creator_credit: Chris Wilcox, Michael Balson and Yowie Films
results.brief_description: An examination of rainforests and remaining wilderness areas focusing on the untouched forests (the Antarctic beech forests of the Upper Hastings River Valley of New South Wales) to show the importance of the conservation movement in preserving our wilderness areas. Studies the attitudes to land use from Aboriginal occupancy through the struggle of white settlers and the golden age of timber to the present day when conservation has become a powerful voice world-wide. Outlines the benefits of a rainforest ecology to man and the effects of the depletion of rainforests on the rest of the ecosystem. Examines the relationship of mill workers to their jobs. Uses archival footage and the words of Henry Thoreau from his book “Walden”. Narrated by John Downes.

results.title: Rebel angel
results.creator_credit: John Read, BBC-TV and RM Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary made to celebrate the bicentenary of the birth of British painter, J.M.W. Turner. It brings together Turner’s sketchbooks, watercolors, oil paintings and the actual locations where he painted, into a comprehensive account of the diverse nature of his creativity. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Chicago blues
results.creator_credit: Harley Cokeliss and Irit Film Production
results.brief_description: Provides an account of the evolution of blues music from its origins in the rural south of America to the contemporary electric sound shaped in the ghettos of Chicago. The harsh experiences of blacks in America and the liberation they found through music are delineated through archival footage, interviews and performances by musicians at home or in Southside clubs. Features amongst others, Muddy Waters, Junior Wells, Floyd Jones, J.B.Hutto and Dick Gregory. This film is suitable for tertiary levels.

results.title: Looks and smiles
results.creator_credit: Ken Loach, Irving Teitelbaum, Black Lion Films and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: This film by Ken Loach, the Director of “Cathy come home”, “Family life and “Kes”, takes a bleak but compassionate look at working-class life in contemporary Britain. It is set in Industrialized Sheffield and while not an attack on the system, the film implicity condemns the system’s failure to cope with economic fluctuations. Script by Barry Hines.
